body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.74-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76504 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** gocemate+b2155773@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Lenovo 80ES / Windows 10 Pro **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Create a control policy and invite a submitter and approver 2. Navigate to Workspace > Workflows and update the submitter's approver to the approver account and the 2nd approver as the admin 3. As submitter, create and submit an expense 4. As approver, approve the expense 5. As submitter, try to delete the expense ## Expected Result: There shouldn't be Delete button on approved expense ## Actual Result: Delete option is present for approved expense and it leads to unexpected error when click Delete ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ec5e3403-b9bb-4a3a-9ebf-6de24da1384b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.73-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @dylanexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1765221776336409) ## Action Performed: 1. title: [$250] Show Create Report option when creating a new expense

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** **Reproducible in production?:** **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): ## Action Performed: 1. Open Global Create 2. Click Create Expense 3. Click on the Report field in the confirmation page 4. Verify you have the option to create a new report tied to the default workspace 5. Open a policy expense chat 6. Click on the + from the composer 7. Click Create expense 8. Click on the Report field in the confirmation page 9. Verify you have the option to create a new report tied to the workspace of the chat ## Expected Result: You should be able to create a new report ## Actual Result: There's no option to create a new report ## Workaround: The user can create a new report and then select it as the report where the new expense is added. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Android-Reports-Empty space seen when deleting expense on "Group-by" filter and resetting it

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.73-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory with https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75962 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2180@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create three manual expenses. 4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses" 5. Tap on "Filters" > "Group By" 6. Tap on "From" and select "Save" 7. Apply the filter. 8. Expand the displayed results. 9. Long tap and select one of the expenses on result. 10. Tap on dropdown menu and delete the expense. 11. Tap on the "Group by" exposed filter and reset it. 12. Note that when you land on "Expenses", only one expense is visible and empty space is visible between expense and exposed filters. ## Expected Result: When using the "Group-by" filter and deleting one expense on the results, no empty space should be created after resetting filter, and remaining expenses should still be correctly visible on expenses list. ## Actual Result: When resetting the "Group-by" filter after deleting an expense on the results, only one of the remaining expenses is visible on expenses list, and an empty space is visible between this expense and exposed filters. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/82aec34a-7409-4a25-973d-b2eecdaa97f4 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
